attributes.action:
Fees Paid - Right To Stay
NI caravan parks
attributes.additional_details:
Wasted money on site fees.
Social distancing can still be adhered to.
No help or support provided by either government or caravan park owners.
People would welcome a change of scenery given the circumstances. Essentially we have all been locked up at home for the past year.
Since the pandemic began we have all been very compliant but it’s unfair to expect people to continue with the large amounts of money being paid out with little/no return.
attributes.background: Give owners the right to make use of their caravans this is the second season we have been restricted and on average each person has paid around £7000. Compensation or money off fees should be made to those customers loosing out.

rejection.details:
Your petition is about something that the Northern Ireland Assembly is responsible for.

If you want to raise this issue you could contact your MLA, or raise it with the Northern Ireland Executive.

You can find contact details for your MLAs here: http://www.niassembly.gov.uk/your-mlas/

You can find contact details for the departments of the Northern Ireland Executive here: https://www.nidirect.gov.uk/contacts/government-departments-in-northern-ireland
